es.fnl.fsm
Class State<E>

java.lang.Object
  es.fnl.fsm.State<E>

final class State<E>
extends Object

A State vertex with outgoing labeled (transition) and empty (epsilon) edges.

It should never be necessary to directly use this class of the generic FSA implementation.

By default, a new State is never final (i.e., does not have the "accept" flag set).

Author:
Florian Leitner

addTransition

void addTransition(Transition<E> t,
                   State<E> s)
Add a transition t to another state s that only triggers if the element in the sequence matches the transition's requirements.

If the element matches, it is consumed.

Parameters:
t - transition (requirement)
s - target state (for the transition)
